intro: Astroloma candolleanum var. horridulum, commonly known as the rough astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy, glandular stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color, arranged in clusters along the stems. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
